intro: Berthelotia sericea, commonly known as the silky bertheleotia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, silvery foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
